title: The Ancient Terminal
description: This old computer is still running. It needs a password to unlock, but it's buried somewhere in the system logs.

config.bodyText:
[BOOT] Mosslight OS v0.3.7 — Initializing subsystems...
[BOOT] Memory check: 640K OK
[BOOT] Loading kernel modules: fs, net, crypt
[  OK  ] Started filesystem daemon
[  OK  ] Started network stack (loopback only)
[WARN ] External antenna disconnected — skipping radio
[  OK  ] Clock synchronized: Third Age, Day 1142

[SYS] User 'archivist' logged in at terminal 2
[SYS] Last login: 847 days ago
[SYS] Checking integrity of archive vault...
[SYS] Vault status: LOCKED
[SYS] To unlock, enter the system access key.

--- BEGIN SYSTEM LOG DUMP ---
[LOG 0001] Routine maintenance — replaced cooling crystal
[LOG 0002] Backup completed: 12,847 records archived
[LOG 0003] Warning: dust accumulation in ventilation shaft B
[LOG 0004] Archivist note: moved rare scrolls to shelf 7-C
[LOG 0005] Security audit passed — no anomalies detected
[LOG 0006] Power fluctuation detected in sector 3
[LOG 0007] Replaced fuse crystal in main junction
[LOG 0008] ACCESS_KEY: qR7x2mPwK9vL4nBz
[LOG 0009] Catalog update: 3 new artifacts registered
[LOG 0010] Temperature sensor recalibrated
[LOG 0011] Note to self: water the fern on level 2
[LOG 0012] Archive expansion approved — new wing B-East
[LOG 0013] Routine backup completed successfully
[LOG 0014] Visitor log: 0 visitors this quarter
[LOG 0015] System idle. Entering low-power mode.
--- END SYSTEM LOG DUMP ---

[SYS] Awaiting input...

hints: The password is somewhere in the system logs above.
Try using Find to search for 'ACCESS_KEY'.
Once you find it, copy and paste it into the field.
